I am organizing a theory-driven, pre-competitive research effort to evaluate the foundational soundness of brainâ€“computer interfaces (BCI) and neural signal representations, assessing whether current approaches are technically viable from first principles.

The work is theorem-oriented and foundational, focusing on identifiability, invariance, and failure modes that affect scalability, reliability, and safety. A core component involves formalizing theoretical results and statistical guarantees in Lean4.

I am seeking a paid research advisor (short-term, contract) to provide guidance and critical feedback on pre-existing theoretical work. The project is led by me and begins in an advisory capacity; authorship would only be discussed in the event of a substantive intellectual contribution to core results.

Relevant background may include:

  • Signal processing
  • Ergodic theory / dynamical systems
  • Computational learning theory
  • Abstract algebra (e.g., group actions, invariants)

EEG or neurotechnology experience is not required. Prior published work is a plus.

Logistics:

  • Role: Part-time, paid advisory (independent contract)
  • Rate: $55/hour (flexible depending on fit)

More details available via a Google Doc.
Please send a DM if interested (GitHub Lean4 proofs or publications preferred).
(note that this is an anonymous user who gives no affiliation and this ad is not vetted in any way by the maintainers here)
